Activity: Check emails and confirm the schedule for introductory calls with potential investors. Review their profiles and investment preferences one last time.
Conduct the first introductory call with a potential UHNWI investor. Clearly articulate the fund's value proposition and answer any questions they may have.
Document the key takeaways from the introductory call. Note any specific interests or concerns expressed by the investor. Share notes with @CIO-1.
Prepare for the next introductory call. Review the investor's background and tailor the presentation to their specific needs.
Conduct the second introductory call with a potential UHNWI investor.
Lunch Break. Catch up on emails and investor related articles.
Follow up with investors from the previous day, sending along requested materials or answering any lingering questions.
Review marketing plan with @MKT-1 (Marketing & Communications Specialist) and create targeted marketing materials for potential UHNWI investors based on feedback from earlier introductory calls.
Debrief on the initial investor calls with @CIO-1. Discuss overall feedback and identify areas for improvement in the investor outreach process.
Update investor tracking spreadsheet with notes from calls and any adjustments needed for future outreach.
